abstract: Ahmed Douma, Egyptian activist who helped lead 2011 uprising that toppled Pres Hosni Mubarak, is sentenced to life in prison as part of crackdown on Islamist and liberal government opponents.
lead_paragraph: A prominent activist, Ahmed Douma, was sentenced on Wednesday to life in prison, officials said, part of a sustained crackdown on Islamist and liberal opponents of the government.

headline.main: Egypt: Activist Receives a Life Sentence
headline.print_headline: Egypt: Activist Receives a Life Sentence

snippet: A prominent activist, Ahmed Douma, was sentenced on Wednesday to life in prison, officials said, part of a sustained crackdown on Islamist and liberal opponents of the government.
